snippet: Valérie Trierweiler, President François Hollande’s companion and the de facto first lady, was admitted to a hospital after a tabloid reported he was having an affair.
abstract: Valerie Trierweiler, companion of President Francois Hollande and France’s de facto first lady, is admitted to hospital after learning along with the rest of France that Hollande is apparently having an affair with another woman; Hollande has not denied veracity of reports but has condemned tabloid magazine in which story was first revealed for prying into his private life.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and MAÏA de la BAUME

lead_paragraph: Valérie Trierweiler, President François Hollande’s companion and the de facto first lady, was admitted to a hospital after a tabloid reported he was having an affair.

headline.print_headline: First Lady of France in Hospital After Report
